title: National Fallen Firefighters Memorial Weekend, 2025
summary: The document is a proclamation by President Donald J. Trump, declaring May 3-4, 2025, as National Fallen Firefighters Memorial Weekend. It honors the bravery and sacrifices of firefighters who have lost their lives in the line of duty over the past year. The event will take place in Emmitsburg, Maryland, where thousands will gather to remember the fallen and support their families. The proclamation reflects on significant moments in history showcasing firefighters' heroism, including their response to the September 11 attacks and recent wildfires in California. The President expresses gratitude for the dedication of firefighters and acknowledges the profound loss experienced by their families. On May 4, the U.S. flag will be flown at half-staff at federal buildings to honor the National Fallen Firefighters Memorial Service. The proclamation emphasizes the importance of recognizing and supporting those who serve their communities in this critical role.
